member.summary: Public constructor with the required fields as parameters

member.summary: Private field for method.

member.summary: The HTTP method to use for the operation. Use MethodTypes to set.

member.summary: The relative path to use for the operation. Use ResourcesEndpoints to set.

member.summary: Any URL params to use, only applies to GET operations.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.OperationModel._body
member.summary: Private field for body object.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.OperationModel.body
member.summary: A string containing the JSON body to use with the request.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.OperationModel.operation_id
member.summary: An optional client-supplied id returned with the operation results.

member.name: T:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.Response.BatchCreateResponseModel
member.summary: Model of the response object returned from create batch operation in mailchimp API

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.Response.BatchCreateResponseModel.id
member.summary: A string that uniquely identifies this batch request.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.Response.BatchCreateResponseModel.status
member.summary: The status of the batch call. Possible Values: pending, started, finished

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.Response.BatchCreateResponseModel.total_operations
member.summary: The total number of operations to complete as part of this batch request. For GET requests requiring pagination, each page counts as a separate operation.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.Response.BatchCreateResponseModel.finished_operations
member.summary: The number of completed operations. This includes operations that returned an error.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.Response.BatchCreateResponseModel.errored_operations
member.summary: The number of completed operations that returned an error.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.Response.BatchCreateResponseModel.submitted_at
member.summary: The time and date when the server received the batch request.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.Response.BatchCreateResponseModel.completed_at
member.summary: The time and date when all operations in the batch request completed.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.Response.BatchCreateResponseModel.response_body_url
member.summary: The URL of the gzipped archive of the results of all the operations.

member.name: T:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.Response.BatchReadAllResponseModel
member.summary: Model that represent the response from batch read all endpoint

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.Response.BatchReadAllResponseModel.batches
member.summary: An array of objects representing batch calls.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.Response.BatchReadAllResponseModel.total_items
member.summary: The total number of items matching the query regardless of pagination.

member.name: T:MailChimpWrapper.Model.Batch.Response.BatchReadResponseModel
member.summary: Model that represent the response from batch read endpoint

member.name: T:MailChimpWrapper.Model.LinksModel
member.summary: Class that encapsulates the link response object from mailchimp

member.summary: As with an HTML ‘rel’ attribute, this describes the type of link.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.LinksModel.href
member.summary: This property contains a fully-qualified URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.LinksModel.method
member.summary: The HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in ‘href’. Possible Values GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS, HEAD.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.LinksModel.targetSchema
member.summary: For GETs, this is a URL representing the schema that the response should conform to.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.LinksModel.schema
member.summary: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to.

member.name: M:MailChimpWrapper.Model.List.ListCreateModel.#ctor(System.String,MailChimpWrapper.Model.List.ContactModel,System.String,MailChimpWrapper.Model.List.CampaignDefaultModel,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Public constructor with the required fields as parameters
member.param: The name of the list.
Contact information displayed in campaign footers to comply with international spam laws.
The permission reminder for the list.
Default values for campaigns created for this list.

Whether the list supports multiple formats for emails. When set to true, subscribers can choose whether they want to receive HTML or plain-text emails. When set to false, subscribers will receive HTML emails, with a plain-text alternative backup.

member.summary: The number of members cleaned from the list.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.List.ListStatsModel.avg_sub_rate

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.List.ListStatsModel.avg_unsub_rate

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.List.ListStatsModel.target_sub_rate
member.summary: The target number of subscriptions per month for the list to keep it growing (not returned if we haven’t calculated it yet).

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.List.ListStatsModel.open_rate
member.summary: The average open rate (a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list (not returned if we haven’t calculated it yet).

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.List.ListStatsModel.click_rate
member.summary: The average click rate (a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list (not returned if we haven’t calculated it yet).

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.List.ListStatsModel.last_sub_date
member.summary: The date and time of the last time someone subscribed to this list.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.List.ListStatsModel.last_unsub_date
member.summary: The date and time of the last time someone unsubscribed from this list.

member.summary: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

member.summary: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn’t change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

member.summary: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.ErrorModel.detail
member.summary: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. Learn more about errors.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.ErrorModel.instance
member.summary: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

member.name: P:MailChimpWrapper.Model.ErrorModel.errors
member.summary: Detailed errors that happened
